children: A 52-year-old man is evaluated for chronic pain in the joints of the hands, ankles, and toes.
A radiograph of the hand is
Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

This patient's plain radiographic findings are consistent with a diagnosis of gout. The radiograph shows periarticular bony erosions, appearing as punched-out bone lesions with disruption of bone cortex (overhanging edges), representing areas of tophaceous monosodium uric acid deposition and accompanying inflammation in a patient with severe, long-standing, inadequately treated gout.

objective.__html: Identify the radiographic findings of gout.
